children.name: Mathematical Physics
children.description: Complex Analysis: Functions, Derivatives, Cauchy-Riemann conditions, Analytic and harmonic functions, Contour integrals, Cauchy-Goursat Theorem, Cauchy integral formula, Taylor series, Laurent series, Singularities, Residue theorem and applications, conformal mapping and application. Partial Differential Equations: Method of separation of variables, Laplace equation, Heat Equation, Wave equations in Cartesian and curvilinear coordinates, Green's function and its applications Integral transformations: Laplace transformations and applications to differential equations, Fourier series, Fourier integrals; Fourier transforms, sine and cosine transforms; solution of PDE by Fourier transform. Group Theory: Groups, subgroups, conjugacy classes, cosets, invariant subgroups, factor groups, kernels, continuous groups, Lie groups, generators, SO(2) and SO(3), SU(2), crystallographic point groups.

children.name: Electromagnetics
children.description: Electrostatics: Gauss's law, potential, Poisson/Laplace equations, boundary value problems and method of images. Magnetostatics: Biot-Savart law, Ampere's law, vector potential, magnetic materials. Maxwell's equations: differential/integral forms, displacement current, energy and momentum (Poynting vector). Electromagnetic waves: wave equation, plane waves in vacuum and media, polarization, reflection and refraction, waveguides basics, radiation from accelerating charges (intro).

children.name: Classical Mechanics
children.description: Principle of least action: Hamilton's principle, Generalised coordinate, Lagrange's equations. Symmetry and conservation laws: cyclic coordinate, energy and momentum conservation, Noether's theorem and symmetry transformations. Two body central force problem: conservation theorems, equation of motion for inverse square law; Kepler's laws, scattering in a central potential. Rigid Body Dynamics: rigid body rotation about a fixed axis, moment of Inertia tensor, Eigen values and principal axis transformations; Euler angles, Euler equations of a rigid body, precession of heavy symmetrical top. Hamiltonian dynamics: Hamilton's equation of motion, Phase space diagram, Poison brackets, Infinitesimal transformations and symmetry generators, Hamilton-Jacobi equation and associated problems. Small oscillations: dynamical matrix, normal modes.

children.name: Computational Physics
children.description: Introduction to scientific computing; numerical errors and stability. Root finding, interpolation, numerical differentiation/integration. Solving linear systems and eigenvalue problems. Numerical solution of ODEs (Euler/Runge-Kutta) and PDEs (finite difference methods). Monte Carlo methods and random number generation; examples from physics simulations and data analysis.

children.name: Heat and Thermodynamics
children.description: Basic Concepts: Temperature, Thermodynamic variables, state functions, processes, equation of state. Zeroth law, temperature scales. First law: heat and work, internal energy, enthalpy, specific heats; adiabatic processes. Second law: Kelvin-Planck and Clausius statements; Carnot cycle; entropy and its properties; Maxwell relations. Thermodynamic potentials: Helmholtz and Gibbs free energies; chemical potential; phase transitions and Clausius-Clapeyron equation. Kinetic theory: distribution functions, mean free path; transport phenomena basics.

children.name: Quantum Mechanics I
children.description: Postulates of quantum mechanics; wave functions, operators and measurement; Schrodinger equation in 1D; probability current and continuity equation. Exactly solvable problems: particle in a box, step/barrier potentials, harmonic oscillator, angular momentum basics. 3D problems and central potentials (intro): hydrogen atom basics, degeneracy and quantum numbers. Formalism: commutators, uncertainty principle, Dirac notation (intro).

children.name: Quantum Mechanics II
children.description: Approximation methods for stationary states: time-independent perturbation theory, the variation method and the Wentzel-Kramers-Brillouin (WKB) method. Time Dependent Perturbation Theory: the Schrodinger and the Heisenberg pictures, Heisenberg equations of motion, the interaction picture; two-level systems, sinusoidal perturbation, Fermi's Golden Rule; the adiabatic and sudden approximation. Special topics in radiation theory: semi-classical treatment of interaction of radiation with matter, Einstein's coefficients, spontaneous and stimulated emission and absorption, application to lasers. Scattering Theory: Born approximation, scattering cross-section, partial wave analysis, phase shifts. Foundations of Quantum mechanics: EPR paradox; Bell's theorem, the no-clone theorem, Schrodinger's Cat.

children.name: Statistical Mechanics
children.description: Probability concept: One dimensional random walk problem and relevant examples; Different probability distributions: Binomial, Gaussian and Poisson distributions; Central limit theorem; Stirling's approximation. Classical statistical mechanics: microcanonical, canonical and grand canonical ensembles; partition function and thermodynamic quantities; classical ideal gas; equipartition theorem. Quantum statistics: Bose-Einstein and Fermi-Dirac distributions; ideal quantum gases; black-body radiation and phonons (intro). Phase transitions and fluctuations (intro).

children.name: Solid State Physics
children.description: Crystal structure and reciprocal lattice; diffraction and Bragg's law. Lattice vibrations and phonons; thermal properties. Free electron theory and band theory; semiconductors and metals; density of states. Electrical conductivity and transport; Hall effect. Magnetism and magnetic materials (intro).

children.name: Atomic and Molecular Spectroscopy
children.description: Atomic structure and spectra: hydrogen atom basics, fine structure, Zeeman and Stark effects, selection rules. Many-electron atoms and coupling schemes; term symbols. Molecular structure: rotational/vibrational spectra, diatomic molecules, electronic transitions, Franck-Condon principle. Spectroscopic techniques and applications.

children.name: Lasers and Ultrafast Optics
children.description: Laser fundamentals: Einstein coefficients, population inversion, gain, optical resonators and modes; laser types and characteristics. Q-switching and mode-locking; pulse generation; ultrafast optics basics. Nonlinear optical effects (intro): second-harmonic generation and related phenomena; applications in spectroscopy and communications (intro).

children.name: Nuclear Science and Engineering
children.description: Nuclear structure and radioactive decay; nuclear reactions and cross-sections. Neutron physics and moderation; reactor basics: criticality, neutron diffusion, reactor kinetics (intro). Radiation detection and dosimetry (intro). Applications in energy, medicine and industry; safety basics.

children.name: Simulation Techniques in Physical Systems
children.description: Introduction to simulation methods, necessity of simulation, numerical errors. Random number generation, tests for random numbers, sampling methods. Monte Carlo integration and applications. Stochastic processes: averages of physical quantities, fluctuations; Markov process and Markov chain; Random walk. Metropolis algorithm. Statistical analysis of data, correlation, autocorrelation. Molecular dynamics basics and numerical integration schemes. Applications in physics simulations.

children.name: Quant. Tech. and Phenom. in Macro. sys.
General Physics Lab
children.description: General physics laboratory experiments covering mechanics, heat, electricity & magnetism, optics, and basic data analysis including uncertainty estimation and report writing.

children.name: Advanced Physics Laboratory
children.description: Experiments based on modern optics, lasers, solid state physics, electronics, microwave, nuclear physics and advanced measurement techniques.

children.name: Measurement Techniques
children.description: Measurement basics: accuracy, precision, errors and statistical analysis. Transducers and sensors; signal conditioning and amplification. Electrical measurement instruments (oscilloscope, multimeters, bridges); noise and filtering. Data acquisition concepts; experimental methods and calibration practices.

children.name: Engineering Optics
children.description: Geometrical optics: Matrix formulation for lens, mirrors and their combination; stop and pupil; cardinal points; chromatic and monochromatic aberrations. Wave optics: interference, diffraction and polarization; coherence and interference devices; diffraction gratings and resolving power; introduction to primary monochromatic aberrations and chromatic aberrations.

children.name: Semiconductor Devices
children.description: Basics: Energy bands; semiconductors; doping; drift and diffusion currents; Einstein relation; quasi-Fermi levels. p-n Junction: diode equation; depletion region; capacitance; breakdown; junction temperature effects. Diode circuits: rectifier; filter; clippers and clampers. Bipolar Junction Transistor: transistor action; Ebers-Moll model; DC characteristics; transistor as amplifier; biasing and stability. Small-signal model and frequency response. Field Effect Transistors: JFET and MOSFET; I-V characteristics; MOS capacitance; threshold voltage; small signal model. Operational Amplifier: basics; ideal op-amp; op-amp circuits; non-idealities and applications.

children.name: Digital electronics and microprocessors
children.description: Digital system basics: number systems, Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential logic, minimization (K-map), flip-flops, counters, registers. Memory and interfacing basics. Microprocessor architecture (intro): instruction set, addressing modes, assembly language programming basics, interrupts, I/O interfacing, timers and serial communication concepts.

children.name: Analog Electronics
children.description: Semiconductor diodes: rectifiers, clippers and clampers. Bipolar junction transistor (BJT): operation, characteristics, biasing and stability, small signal model, amplifiers and frequency response. Field effect transistors (FET): JFET and MOSFET characteristics, biasing, small signal model and amplifiers. Feedback and oscillators: feedback principles, stability, RC/LC oscillators. Operational amplifiers: ideal/non-ideal op-amp, basic configurations (inverting/non-inverting), applications (filters, integrators, differentiators).

children.name: Electronics Laboratory - I
children.description: Laboratory experiments on analog and digital electronics such as diode and transistor characteristics, amplifier circuits, op-amp circuits, filters/oscillators, logic gates and flip-flops, and basic instrumentation/measurement practices.

children.name: Electronics Lab-II
children.description: Laboratory experiments on advanced analog/digital electronics and instrumentation, including amplifier design, op-amp applications, filters/oscillators, and microprocessor/digital interfacing experiments (as per department lab modules).
